title: Alacritty on GNOME takes some time to show up in the application switcher
body:
When starting Alacritty via the pinned dock icon or via GNOME search it starts immediately, but it takes some time (~ 20 seconds) until it is being shown in the application switcher and in the dock (via the dot below the pinned icon).

According to [this issue on the GNOME Gitlab](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-shell/-/issues/4920) instance there is a certain API (startup_notification/xdg_activation) which needs to be used to tell GNOME that an application has been started.

Could this be the issue why this happens?

### System

OS: Linux
Version: alacritty 0.13.2 (bb8ea18e)
Linux/BSD: GNOME 47 Wayland
